meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stubborn.
meanings.sent1: Her stubbornnesses made it hard to change her mind.
meanings.sent2: His stubbornnesses often led to arguments with his friends.
meanings.sent3: Despite his stubbornnesses, he eventually agreed to try the new restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The stubbornnesses of the old tree roots made them difficult to remove.
meanings.sent5: The stubbornnesses of the toddler were on full display during the tantrum.

meanings.sent1: The stubbornnesses of her refusal were evident to everyone.
meanings.sent2: His stubbornnesses in negotiations often caused delays.
meanings.sent3: The stubbornnesses of the cat refusing to move from the warm spot amused the family.
meanings.sent4: The stubbornnesses of the lock made it impossible to open without the key.
meanings.sent5: The stubbornnesses of the old car engine refusing to start frustrated the owner.

meanings.sent1: His stubbornnesses were evident in his reluctance to try new things.
meanings.sent2: The stubbornnesses of the child showed in the way she insisted on doing things her way.
meanings.sent3: The stubbornnesses of the computer to freeze at the worst times always brought a chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The stubbornnesses of the storm clouds refusing to move on made for a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The stubbornnesses of the old dog to go for a walk every morning were endearing to the family.
